title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.LOG.content: [Heidegger’s ear] hearing more than just picking up sounds, if it is [anatomical, biological], goes in one ear out the other [but, apprehension lives (lebt) only when embodied (leibt)] > in that case, we are not gathered to what is addressed (Zugesprochene) [heterotautology of hearing and hearkening (Horchen)] > wrong direction: turn anatomical hearing into a spiritual one
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: [Heidegger’s ear] hearing more than just picking up sounds, if it is [anatomical, biological], goes in one ear out the other [but, apprehension lives (lebt) only when embodied (leibt)] > in that case, we are not gathered to what is addressed (Zugesprochene) [heterotautology of hearing and hearkening (Horchen)] > wrong direction: turn anatomical hearing into a spiritual one

HDG.IM.content: acc. Heidegger, Nietzsche’s wispy Being the guiding conception of Being since early days of his philosophical labor: supports/determines his philosophy from ground up [isn’t that your bias?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Nietzsche’s wispy Being the guiding conception of Being since early days of his philosophical labor: supports/determines his philosophy from ground up [isn’t that your bias?]

HDG.IM.content: only in philosophy that essential relations to beings always take shape [but you still have not answered Nietzsche’s question]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: only in philosophy that essential relations to beings always take shape [but you still have not answered Nietzsche’s question]

HDG.BC.content: [beyond philosophy] indefinite title Grundbegriffe: do not commit ourselves to anything in advance [Heidegger opens] > “readiness to put the essence of man at risk in thinking that which grounds this essence,” that which he takes for being [Heidegger closes?]: “whatever grounds everything and gives ground to everything is itself the ground” [causa sui?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [beyond philosophy] indefinite title Grundbegriffe: do not commit ourselves to anything in advance [Heidegger opens] > “readiness to put the essence of man at risk in thinking that which grounds this essence,” that which he takes for being [Heidegger closes?]: “whatever grounds everything and gives ground to everything is itself the ground” [causa sui?]

HDG.BC.content: [almost Freudian] unrest as the surge of mere life revealing itself, to remain thrust/forced into its own craving belongs to essence of living [conatus] > man over animal can elevate living/craving into guiding measure, make it the “principle” of “progress” [Kant]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [almost Freudian] unrest as the surge of mere life revealing itself, to remain thrust/forced into its own craving belongs to essence of living [conatus] > man over animal can elevate living/craving into guiding measure, make it the “principle” of “progress” [Kant]

HDG.BC.content: [in atomic age, in atomic physics] what is “unforeseeable (Unvorhersehbare),” can’t be calculated/computed in advance, shows itself as something new, can’t be explained by something else—lacks a cause (atomic physics, w/ its invalidation of law of causality, refutes Kant, all previous philosophy [?]) > what is “uncaused,” [acc. atomic physics]: “spontaneous,” free
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [in atomic age, in atomic physics] what is “unforeseeable (Unvorhersehbare),” can’t be calculated/computed in advance, shows itself as something new, can’t be explained by something else—lacks a cause (atomic physics, w/ its invalidation of law of causality, refutes Kant, all previous philosophy [?]) > what is “uncaused,” [acc. atomic physics]: “spontaneous,” free

HDG.BC.content: place of man w/in beings (being that calculates, gift of reason), organism that deifies “reason” (1st happened in French Revolution) > “life” not, for man, object standing opposite him: life is what life itself accomplishes, enjoys, survives, what it guides through itself, carries by its own stream [river, Heraclitus], life is (as taught since 19th Century) “lived experience (Erlebnis)” > life veritably “overflows” w/ “lived experiences”
HDG.BC.linkedContent: place of man w/in beings (being that calculates, gift of reason), organism that deifies “reason” (1st happened in French Revolution) > “life” not, for man, object standing opposite him: life is what life itself accomplishes, enjoys, survives, what it guides through itself, carries by its own stream [river, Heraclitus], life is (as taught since 19th Century) “lived experience (Erlebnis)” > life veritably “overflows” w/ “lived experiences”

HDG.BC.content: one can capture “lived experiences” in reports > essence of man securely delimited: man is the presencing animal (animal rationale) [?] > balance btwn “calculability” of life & drunkenness of lived experience > anthropology, Americans seek determination of what man is, how he can be most efficiently/effectively used (am wirksamsten zu gebrauchen sei) , in most appropriate place, w/out loss of time or energy [Marx-like]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: one can capture “lived experiences” in reports > essence of man securely delimited: man is the presencing animal (animal rationale) [?] > balance btwn “calculability” of life & drunkenness of lived experience > anthropology, Americans seek determination of what man is, how he can be most efficiently/effectively used (am wirksamsten zu gebrauchen sei) , in most appropriate place, w/out loss of time or energy [Marx-like]

HDG.WM.content: practical goals, technical organization: unites dispersed atrophied sciences [Husserl] > exactness of science vs. rigor of philosophy
HDG.WM.linkedContent: practical goals, technical organization: unites dispersed atrophied sciences [Husserl] > exactness of science vs. rigor of philosophy

HDG.WM.content: going beyond beings occurs in essence of Dasein > this going beyond is metaphysics itself—thus, metaphysics belongs to “nature of the human being” > “because the truth of metaphysics dwells in this abyssal ground [hermeneutic circle of Dasein & metaphysics] it stands in closest proximity to the constantly lurking possibility of deepest error” > [but philosophy was born?] the getting under way of metaphysics, the coming to itself of philosophy, to its explicit tasks
HDG.WM.linkedContent: going beyond beings occurs in essence of Dasein > this going beyond is metaphysics itself—thus, metaphysics belongs to “nature of the human being” > “because the truth of metaphysics dwells in this abyssal ground [hermeneutic circle of Dasein & metaphysics] it stands in closest proximity to the constantly lurking possibility of deepest error” > [but philosophy was born?] the getting under way of metaphysics, the coming to itself of philosophy, to its explicit tasks

HDG.WM.content: for philosophy to get underway: 1) allow space for beings as a whole 2) release ourselves into the nothing, liberate ourselves from idols 3) let sweep of our suspense (Schwebens) take its full course, so it swings back to fundamental question of metaphysics [possibility of “why” makes it possible to ground things > destiny of our existence placed in hands of researcher (Forschers) (Nietzsche)] [destiny, question, ground of metaphysics, beyond metaphysics]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: for philosophy to get underway: 1) allow space for beings as a whole 2) release ourselves into the nothing, liberate ourselves from idols 3) let sweep of our suspense (Schwebens) take its full course, so it swings back to fundamental question of metaphysics [possibility of “why” makes it possible to ground things > destiny of our existence placed in hands of researcher (Forschers) (Nietzsche)] [destiny, question, ground of metaphysics, beyond metaphysics]

HDG.IWM.content: truth of Being called ground, that which nourishes root of tree of philosophy (i.e. metaphysics) > in the ground, roots forget themselves for sake of tree > philosophy doesn’t gather itself upon its ground, always leaves (never escapes) its ground, by means of metaphysics
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: truth of Being called ground, that which nourishes root of tree of philosophy (i.e. metaphysics) > in the ground, roots forget themselves for sake of tree > philosophy doesn’t gather itself upon its ground, always leaves (never escapes) its ground, by means of metaphysics

HDG.IWM.content: time belongs to truth of Being in a way still concealed > every holding open of truth of Being must look toward time as possible horizon of an understanding of Being [not there yet, telos] > time as provisional goal in Being and Time ——[nice, clever] proof of oblivion of Being, the reception of Being and Time ——ontotheology (first philosophy, philosophy proper) as twofold: truth of beings in their universality & in highest being
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: time belongs to truth of Being in a way still concealed > every holding open of truth of Being must look toward time as possible horizon of an understanding of Being [not there yet, telos] > time as provisional goal in Being and Time ——[nice, clever] proof of oblivion of Being, the reception of Being and Time ——ontotheology (first philosophy, philosophy proper) as twofold: truth of beings in their universality & in highest being

HDG.QB.content: people have tended to represent “oblivion of being” as if Being were an umbrella forgotten by some philosophy professor [Nietzsche, cf. S] > oblivion, concealing of as yet unrevealed essence (Wesen) (verbal—essential unfolding) of X Being, shelters (birgt) untapped treasures, promise (Versprechen) of a find that awaits appropriate seeking (das gemässe Suchen wartet) > to have premonition (vermuten) of this doesn’t require prophetic gifts but only attentiveness (Achtung), practiced for decades, to that announced (bekundet) in metaphysical thinking [Heidegger’s askesis]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: people have tended to represent “oblivion of being” as if Being were an umbrella forgotten by some philosophy professor [Nietzsche, cf. S] > oblivion, concealing of as yet unrevealed essence (Wesen) (verbal—essential unfolding) of X Being, shelters (birgt) untapped treasures, promise (Versprechen) of a find that awaits appropriate seeking (das gemässe Suchen wartet) > to have premonition (vermuten) of this doesn’t require prophetic gifts but only attentiveness (Achtung), practiced for decades, to that announced (bekundet) in metaphysical thinking [Heidegger’s askesis]

HDG.FS.content: destiny of being (Geschick des Seins), will we be able to think it on its own terms [arrival]?: the task of thinking (Aufgabe des Denkens), which poetry is “heilsame Gefahr (wholesome danger)”: poetry has been faithful to site (Stätte) of inceptual upsurge (ursprünglichen Auf-gehens) [philosophy less faithful?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: destiny of being (Geschick des Seins), will we be able to think it on its own terms [arrival]?: the task of thinking (Aufgabe des Denkens), which poetry is “heilsame Gefahr (wholesome danger)”: poetry has been faithful to site (Stätte) of inceptual upsurge (ursprünglichen Auf-gehens) [philosophy less faithful?]

HDG.FS.content: if “scission (Ent-zweiung)” is source (Quell) of need for philosophy, if philosophy arises as soon as it is torn, “what is the driving force (treibende Kraft) of the dichotomy (Entzweiung)? > if tearing is necessary, can one speak of unity before tearing?
HDG.FS.linkedContent: if “scission (Ent-zweiung)” is source (Quell) of need for philosophy, if philosophy arises as soon as it is torn, “what is the driving force (treibende Kraft) of the dichotomy (Entzweiung)? > if tearing is necessary, can one speak of unity before tearing?

HDG.FS.content: acc. Heidegger, Aristotle’s Physics, must pass through this book to enter philosophy, can replace entire library of philosophical works
HDG.FS.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Aristotle’s Physics, must pass through this book to enter philosophy, can replace entire library of philosophical works

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger tells us to understand “need of philosophy” as genitivus subjectivus [limiting double genitive], what philosophy needs to be authentic philosophy
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger tells us to understand “need of philosophy” as genitivus subjectivus [limiting double genitive], what philosophy needs to be authentic philosophy

HDG.FS.content: Hegel uses word science (Wissenschaft) in Fichte’s sense, “System of Science,” system of philosophy, “Science”: philosophy become absolute knowledge (of subject)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel uses word science (Wissenschaft) in Fichte’s sense, “System of Science,” system of philosophy, “Science”: philosophy become absolute knowledge (of subject)

HDG.FS.content: philosophy as an attempt at conjoining, Parmenides’ en, the being of beings, being not an empty word, exchangeable currency, always concretely apprehended as present (Gegenwart), as presence (Anwesenheit)—what is relation btwn presence/unity?
HDG.FS.linkedContent: philosophy as an attempt at conjoining, Parmenides’ en, the being of beings, being not an empty word, exchangeable currency, always concretely apprehended as present (Gegenwart), as presence (Anwesenheit)—what is relation btwn presence/unity?

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger recognizes an accusation that he derived “being” from “is,” developed his philosophy form this “abstraction” > no, can only say “is” in openness of Being
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger recognizes an accusation that he derived “being” from “is,” developed his philosophy form this “abstraction” > no, can only say “is” in openness of Being

HDG.FS.content: God as Summum Ens, actus purus essendi—how does Aristotle’s energeia become actualitas? > Romans understood ergon, energeia, on basis of AGERE, “to make,” in an ontic sense, so Summum ens becomes CREATOR, ENS CREATUM (INCREATUM) > ontic determination of actualitas together w/ Aquinas’ Summum Ens w/ Ipsum esse, ontology suppresses possibility for question of Being > to restore (weider einsetzen) philosophy to its own essence: purge (entlasten) it of its Christian element
HDG.FS.linkedContent: God as Summum Ens, actus purus essendi—how does Aristotle’s energeia become actualitas? > Romans understood ergon, energeia, on basis of AGERE, “to make,” in an ontic sense, so Summum ens becomes CREATOR, ENS CREATUM (INCREATUM) > ontic determination of actualitas together w/ Aquinas’ Summum Ens w/ Ipsum esse, ontology suppresses possibility for question of Being > to restore (weider einsetzen) philosophy to its own essence: purge (entlasten) it of its Christian element

HDG.FS.content: [why the Greeks? philosophy only able to emerge among Greeks?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [why the Greeks? philosophy only able to emerge among Greeks?]

HDG.FS.content: dimension of entirely excessive [totally other?] is that in which philosophy arises (entspringt), philosophy as answer (Antwort) of a humanity struck (betroffenen) by excess of presence, philosophy as a hyper-Greek way of ek-sisting
HDG.FS.linkedContent: dimension of entirely excessive [totally other?] is that in which philosophy arises (entspringt), philosophy as answer (Antwort) of a humanity struck (betroffenen) by excess of presence, philosophy as a hyper-Greek way of ek-sisting

HDG.FS.content: being is not a being: the ontological difference > difference not produced by metaphysics, it maintains/subtends metaphysics > said in Kantian manner, ontological difference is condition of possibility for ontology > ontological difference reigns in all philosophy, fundamentally concealed, never thematized [Derrida’s described not declared]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: being is not a being: the ontological difference > difference not produced by metaphysics, it maintains/subtends metaphysics > said in Kantian manner, ontological difference is condition of possibility for ontology > ontological difference reigns in all philosophy, fundamentally concealed, never thematized [Derrida’s described not declared]

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger somewhat aligns himself w/ Marx, though he insists via question that every interpretation [of genuine thinking] can/must lead to transformation (Veränderung) of world > Heidegger also insists that praxis in Marx is determined by a theory of production as production of human itself (founded in Hegelian philosophy) > theory/praxis: sisters born from unknown parents [baby daddy]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger somewhat aligns himself w/ Marx, though he insists via question that every interpretation [of genuine thinking] can/must lead to transformation (Veränderung) of world > Heidegger also insists that praxis in Marx is determined by a theory of production as production of human itself (founded in Hegelian philosophy) > theory/praxis: sisters born from unknown parents [baby daddy]

HDG.FS.content: Marx reverses Hegel’s idealism (uniquely), requires that Being be given precedence over consciousness [?] > for Marx, Being is production process, receives this representation from metaphysics via Hegel’s interpretation of life as process
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Marx reverses Hegel’s idealism (uniquely), requires that Being be given precedence over consciousness [?] > for Marx, Being is production process, receives this representation from metaphysics via Hegel’s interpretation of life as process

HDG.FS.content: most extreme danger [the worst?]: man feels only necessity of self-production (question of computer language) > physics can’t leap beyond itself, nor can politics (which lives today in dimension of science)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: most extreme danger [the worst?]: man feels only necessity of self-production (question of computer language) > physics can’t leap beyond itself, nor can politics (which lives today in dimension of science)

HDG.FS.content: nothing characterizes being: ontological proposition > when nothing & its negating aren’t understood negatively, being is something entirely other (etwas ganz und gar Anders) than a being > participle “nihilating (nichtend)” as determinate activity of being, durch die allein das Seiende ist > name it an origin if all ontic-causal overtones are excluded [possible?]: Ereignis of Being as condition for arrival (Ankunft) of beings: das Sein lasst das Seinde anwesen [factical life]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: nothing characterizes being: ontological proposition > when nothing & its negating aren’t understood negatively, being is something entirely other (etwas ganz und gar Anders) than a being > participle “nihilating (nichtend)” as determinate activity of being, durch die allein das Seiende ist > name it an origin if all ontic-causal overtones are excluded [possible?]: Ereignis of Being as condition for arrival (Ankunft) of beings: das Sein lasst das Seinde anwesen [factical life]

HDG.FS.content: Weltlichkeit der Welt (Umweltanalyse) > Heidegger explains how, for first time [in Being and Time], being-in-the-world (In-der-Welt-sein) discovered as primary/irreducible fact, always already given, radically “prior” to consciousness [factical life] > still, this facticity is only “concrete” way of approaching project itself [the guiding aim (das leitende Ziel)] > [facticity subordinate to the Seinsfrage]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Weltlichkeit der Welt (Umweltanalyse) > Heidegger explains how, for first time [in Being and Time], being-in-the-world (In-der-Welt-sein) discovered as primary/irreducible fact, always already given, radically “prior” to consciousness [factical life] > still, this facticity is only “concrete” way of approaching project itself [the guiding aim (das leitende Ziel)] > [facticity subordinate to the Seinsfrage]

HDG.FS.content: twofold seeing: two visions: sensuous vision & categorial vision > difficulty in double signification of seeing (one that already governs Plato’s philosophy)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: twofold seeing: two visions: sensuous vision & categorial vision > difficulty in double signification of seeing (one that already governs Plato’s philosophy)

HDG.FS.content: the thinking here [Greek thought]: tautological thinking: primordial sense of phenomenology, prior to any distinction btwn theory/praxis > in philosophy there are only paths (Wege), in sciences only methods > to understand phenomenology: path that leads away to come before…, “lets that before which it is led show itself”: a phenomenology of the inapparent > now you can understand: there were no concepts for Greeks
HDG.FS.linkedContent: the thinking here [Greek thought]: tautological thinking: primordial sense of phenomenology, prior to any distinction btwn theory/praxis > in philosophy there are only paths (Wege), in sciences only methods > to understand phenomenology: path that leads away to come before…, “lets that before which it is led show itself”: a phenomenology of the inapparent > now you can understand: there were no concepts for Greeks

HDG.MA.content: Nobel prize winners declare “Science is a road to a happier human life” > this statement as far as possible from reflective insight into our age, forget to ponder/ask: what is ground that enabled modern technology to discover/set free new energies in nature? > nature has become a “gigantic gasoline station” [Ge-stell] (technical epoch developed in 17th century Europe)
HDG.MA.linkedContent: Nobel prize winners declare “Science is a road to a happier human life” > this statement as far as possible from reflective insight into our age, forget to ponder/ask: what is ground that enabled modern technology to discover/set free new energies in nature? > nature has become a “gigantic gasoline station” [Ge-stell] (technical epoch developed in 17th century Europe)

HDG.MA.content: releasement (Gelassenheit) toward things: “yes” & “no” to technology, let devices into our life but remain dependent on something highter
HDG.MA.linkedContent: releasement (Gelassenheit) toward things: “yes” & “no” to technology, let devices into our life but remain dependent on something highter

HDG.MA.content: possible that technology in atomic age could captivate/bewitch/dazzle/beguile so that calculative thinking accepted/practiced as the only way of thinking [end of philosophy] > keep meditative thinking: persistent courageous thinking allows Gelassenheit, openness to Geheimnis, to flourish
HDG.MA.linkedContent: possible that technology in atomic age could captivate/bewitch/dazzle/beguile so that calculative thinking accepted/practiced as the only way of thinking [end of philosophy] > keep meditative thinking: persistent courageous thinking allows Gelassenheit, openness to Geheimnis, to flourish

HDG.DL.content: language defines (bestimmt) the hermeneutic relation: go right on releasing (entlassen) into open whatever might be said (not a non-committal drifting away)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: language defines (bestimmt) the hermeneutic relation: go right on releasing (entlassen) into open whatever might be said (not a non-committal drifting away)

HDG.DL.content: Heidegger associates phenomenological experience (Erlebnis) w/ “consciousness,” subject/object, refers life back to “I” > Heidegger tried to leave this experience behind in hermeneutic relation of two-fold [Heidegger affirms Erfahrung over Erlebnis?], but “nobody can in just one single leap take distance from the predominant circle of ideas,” especially re: well-worn tracks (langem eingefahrenen Bahnen)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: Heidegger associates phenomenological experience (Erlebnis) w/ “consciousness,” subject/object, refers life back to “I” > Heidegger tried to leave this experience behind in hermeneutic relation of two-fold [Heidegger affirms Erfahrung over Erlebnis?], but “nobody can in just one single leap take distance from the predominant circle of ideas,” especially re: well-worn tracks (langem eingefahrenen Bahnen)

HDG.LP.content: soul: great giver of life > everything that is alive is painful > pain is the animator (Beseelende) [cf. 180 the soul is the animator] > only the soulful fulfills destiny, capable, gifted as such, of joining in harmony the mutual bearing (wechselweisen Sichtragens) by which all living things belong > relation of fitness (Bezug des Taugens), all that lives is fit, i.e. good: good is good painfully > only true in pain > because pain is converse, kann das Lebende sein Mitanwesendes in seiner jeweiligen Art verbergend entbergen [sheltering concealment], wahr-haft [preservation/truth] sein lassen [truth as letting beings truly be what they are]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: soul: great giver of life > everything that is alive is painful > pain is the animator (Beseelende) [cf. 180 the soul is the animator] > only the soulful fulfills destiny, capable, gifted as such, of joining in harmony the mutual bearing (wechselweisen Sichtragens) by which all living things belong > relation of fitness (Bezug des Taugens), all that lives is fit, i.e. good: good is good painfully > only true in pain > because pain is converse, kann das Lebende sein Mitanwesendes in seiner jeweiligen Art verbergend entbergen [sheltering concealment], wahr-haft [preservation/truth] sein lassen [truth as letting beings truly be what they are]

HDG.WL.content: attempting a way to language by speaking testifies (bezeugt) that language has woven us into speaking [why?] > this web (Geflecht) is the predetermined realm (vorbestimmten Bereich) that any reflection on language (linguistic theory, philosophy of language, etc.) must live (aufhalten) [factical life of language]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: attempting a way to language by speaking testifies (bezeugt) that language has woven us into speaking [why?] > this web (Geflecht) is the predetermined realm (vorbestimmten Bereich) that any reflection on language (linguistic theory, philosophy of language, etc.) must live (aufhalten) [factical life of language]

HDG.WL.content: Ereignis gathers the Aufriss of Sage & unfolds it into Gefüge of manifold Showing, Ereignis is most inconspicuous (Unscheinbarste) of phenomena, simplest of simplicities, nearest of near, farthest of far—in which mortals spend their lives
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Ereignis gathers the Aufriss of Sage & unfolds it into Gefüge of manifold Showing, Ereignis is most inconspicuous (Unscheinbarste) of phenomena, simplest of simplicities, nearest of near, farthest of far—in which mortals spend their lives

HDG.TC.content: deliberately speaking of annihilation (Vernichtung), not just destruction (Zerstörung): annihilation is the more encompassing (umfassendere) destruction (also takes into account destruction of countless lives) > can only speak of annihilation by intimations (Andeutungen), point away from what is not meant > annihilation not the highest grade of destruction but essentially other (wesenhaft anderes) than destruction > always something left over w/ destruction, no “remainderless (restlose)” destruction > there is no annihilation at all: the destruction where nothing left remaining, this remainder (Übrig) is nothing: has consumed (aufgezehrt) every “is” & itself > from destruction to annihilation, a change of condition, leap into another essence > not only nothing still left remaining in annihilation, but something, and only, of its own arises (entsteht)
HDG.TC.linkedContent: deliberately speaking of annihilation (Vernichtung), not just destruction (Zerstörung): annihilation is the more encompassing (umfassendere) destruction (also takes into account destruction of countless lives) > can only speak of annihilation by intimations (Andeutungen), point away from what is not meant > annihilation not the highest grade of destruction but essentially other (wesenhaft anderes) than destruction > always something left over w/ destruction, no “remainderless (restlose)” destruction > there is no annihilation at all: the destruction where nothing left remaining, this remainder (Übrig) is nothing: has consumed (aufgezehrt) every “is” & itself > from destruction to annihilation, a change of condition, leap into another essence > not only nothing still left remaining in annihilation, but something, and only, of its own arises (entsteht)

HDG.EC.content: desert is wasteland, deserted abandonment (Verlassenheit) of all life, nothing can emerge from itself [Greek physis] in this wasteland, & in this emergence (Aufgang) call others into a co-emerging (Mitaufgehen) > no perishing (Untergehen) in this desolation
HDG.EC.linkedContent: desert is wasteland, deserted abandonment (Verlassenheit) of all life, nothing can emerge from itself [Greek physis] in this wasteland, & in this emergence (Aufgang) call others into a co-emerging (Mitaufgehen) > no perishing (Untergehen) in this desolation

HDG.EC.content: abandonment of life as abandonment of Being, no longer allows for any beings > or, is a historical age where “life” in some form holds sway (herrscht), “the age of devastation”? [biopolitics?]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: abandonment of life as abandonment of Being, no longer allows for any beings > or, is a historical age where “life” in some form holds sway (herrscht), “the age of devastation”? [biopolitics?]

HDG.EC.content: under appearance of secured/improving life, a barring (Verwehrung) of life could occur: the being of all that is, ambiguous (zweideutig) to the core
HDG.EC.linkedContent: under appearance of secured/improving life, a barring (Verwehrung) of life could occur: the being of all that is, ambiguous (zweideutig) to the core

HDG.EC.content: the most difficult: to advise those affected by devastation w/out paternalism (Bevormundung), or haughtiness, prepare them for meditation required to become familiar w/ devastation as event that prevails outside human guilt (Schuld)/atonement (Sühne)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: the most difficult: to advise those affected by devastation w/out paternalism (Bevormundung), or haughtiness, prepare them for meditation required to become familiar w/ devastation as event that prevails outside human guilt (Schuld)/atonement (Sühne)

HDG.EC.content: waiting as though we pass unnoticed, unnamed [don’t know what we are], otherwise than all Erwarten, we’re not there for all who await/expect > in waiting, we’ve gone entirely away (ganz weggegangen), to our essence, required (gebraucht) by pure coming as inlet that answers it (als der Einlass, der ihm antwortet)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: waiting as though we pass unnoticed, unnamed [don’t know what we are], otherwise than all Erwarten, we’re not there for all who await/expect > in waiting, we’ve gone entirely away (ganz weggegangen), to our essence, required (gebraucht) by pure coming as inlet that answers it (als der Einlass, der ihm antwortet)

HDG.EC.content: [Chinese philosophy] “human needs only enough space to be able to put his foot down” > but what use would be that standing if a crevice opened up to the underworld around it? [shortest shadow] > no more use > from this, necessity of unnecessary clearly apparent
HDG.EC.linkedContent: [Chinese philosophy] “human needs only enough space to be able to put his foot down” > but what use would be that standing if a crevice opened up to the underworld around it? [shortest shadow] > no more use > from this, necessity of unnecessary clearly apparent

HDG.OHF.content: hermenutics: wakefulness (Wachsein) of Dasein for itself (not conventional understanding) > interpreting is a being, a distinctive how of character of being of facticity, that belongs to factical life itself (facticity not the object of hermeneutics) > chance that hermeneutics will go wrong belongs to its ownmost being
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: hermenutics: wakefulness (Wachsein) of Dasein for itself (not conventional understanding) > interpreting is a being, a distinctive how of character of being of facticity, that belongs to factical life itself (facticity not the object of hermeneutics) > chance that hermeneutics will go wrong belongs to its ownmost being

HDG.OHF.content: being of factical life is distinctive: it is in the how of the being of its being-possible > authentic be-ing itself places (gestellt) facticity into our forehaving (Vorhabe) > the explicata that grow out of this interpretation: existentials
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: being of factical life is distinctive: it is in the how of the being of its being-possible > authentic be-ing itself places (gestellt) facticity into our forehaving (Vorhabe) > the explicata that grow out of this interpretation: existentials

HDG.OHF.content: Kierkegaard: life only interpreted after lived, Christ couldn’t explain scriptures until after his resurrection
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Kierkegaard: life only interpreted after lived, Christ couldn’t explain scriptures until after his resurrection

HDG.OHF.content: interpretation begins in the today (im Heute), average understanding from which philosophy lives and speaks back into > the “every-one (Das Man),” not just fallenness, but a How of factical Dasein
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: interpretation begins in the today (im Heute), average understanding from which philosophy lives and speaks back into > the “every-one (Das Man),” not just fallenness, but a How of factical Dasein

HDG.OHF.content: philosophy a mode of knowing in factical life itself, in which factical Dasein ruthlessly dragged back to itself, relentlessly thrown back (zurückreisst) on itself [cf. CPC p. 13]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: philosophy a mode of knowing in factical life itself, in which factical Dasein ruthlessly dragged back to itself, relentlessly thrown back (zurückreisst) on itself [cf. CPC p. 13]

HDG.OHF.content: [on demands for and against types of presuppositions: cries of anxiety in face of philosophy]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [on demands for and against types of presuppositions: cries of anxiety in face of philosophy]

HDG.OHF.content: all talking about hermeneutics misunderstands it, the wakefulness for facticity must temporalize/unfold “there” > hermeneutics [Heidegger admits to making a personal statement] not philosophy at all, something preliminary (Vorläufiges), has its own explanation (Bewandtnis) for being: what’s at issue in it, not to be finished quickly, rather to hold out in it as long as possible (möglichste lange darin auszuhalten) [slow down] > we’ve become so weak-kneed, pithless, can’t hold out in asking a qustion
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: all talking about hermeneutics misunderstands it, the wakefulness for facticity must temporalize/unfold “there” > hermeneutics [Heidegger admits to making a personal statement] not philosophy at all, something preliminary (Vorläufiges), has its own explanation (Bewandtnis) for being: what’s at issue in it, not to be finished quickly, rather to hold out in it as long as possible (möglichste lange darin auszuhalten) [slow down] > we’ve become so weak-kneed, pithless, can’t hold out in asking a qustion

HDG.OHF.content: [existential analytic defines the how of Dasein’s being] [re: temporality of today?] Dasein has its open space of publicness (Öffentlichkeit) and its ways of Seeing (seine Sicht) [there] [cf. 38 summary of today] > moves in definite mode of discourse (Redens) about itself: Gerede (talk) preserves Dasein in averageness > in talk lies guiding “as what” by which Dasein addresses “itself” > talk as the how in which Dasein’s having-been-interpreted (Ausgelegtheit) stands at its disposal > not externally applied to Dasein, something from out of which it lives, is lived, a how of is being
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [existential analytic defines the how of Dasein’s being] [re: temporality of today?] Dasein has its open space of publicness (Öffentlichkeit) and its ways of Seeing (seine Sicht) [there] [cf. 38 summary of today] > moves in definite mode of discourse (Redens) about itself: Gerede (talk) preserves Dasein in averageness > in talk lies guiding “as what” by which Dasein addresses “itself” > talk as the how in which Dasein’s having-been-interpreted (Ausgelegtheit) stands at its disposal > not externally applied to Dasein, something from out of which it lives, is lived, a how of is being

HDG.OHF.content: as open space of publicness, nothing eludes the talk: averageness (Durchschnittlichkeit), discusses everything w/ insensitivity to difference (Unterschiedsunempfindlichkeit) > Öffentlichkeit as being of “Man (every-one)”: everyone says that, everyone expects that, talk in circulation belongs to no one [Irigaray] > “Man” = “Niemand” > Dasein haunted like a specter by this circulation, a how of factical life that pays tribute to the fateful undoing (Verhängnisses) of facticity
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: as open space of publicness, nothing eludes the talk: averageness (Durchschnittlichkeit), discusses everything w/ insensitivity to difference (Unterschiedsunempfindlichkeit) > Öffentlichkeit as being of “Man (every-one)”: everyone says that, everyone expects that, talk in circulation belongs to no one [Irigaray] > “Man” = “Niemand” > Dasein haunted like a specter by this circulation, a how of factical life that pays tribute to the fateful undoing (Verhängnisses) of facticity

HDG.OHF.content: [periodization] historical human sciences view life of culture as objectifications of the subjective (don’t further examine character of being): culture is an organism, autonomous organic life > Spengler took this way of seeing the past the furthest [?], had courage to actualize [further than Nietzsche?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [periodization] historical human sciences view life of culture as objectifications of the subjective (don’t further examine character of being): culture is an organism, autonomous organic life > Spengler took this way of seeing the past the furthest [?], had courage to actualize [further than Nietzsche?]

HDG.OHF.content: [method, don’t refute but hermeneut philosophy of today]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method, don’t refute but hermeneut philosophy of today]

HDG.OHF.content: how dialectic places itself above phenomenology: 1) best phenomenology can do: define appearance of Spirit in its 1st stage 2) dialectic alone can penetrate irrational > it’s true, phenomenology is 1st stage of immediate knowledge—but only from point of view of dialectic [nothing can be decided here, dialectic already presupposed] > phenomenology does place limit on knowing (is that a defect?)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: how dialectic places itself above phenomenology: 1) best phenomenology can do: define appearance of Spirit in its 1st stage 2) dialectic alone can penetrate irrational > it’s true, phenomenology is 1st stage of immediate knowledge—but only from point of view of dialectic [nothing can be decided here, dialectic already presupposed] > phenomenology does place limit on knowing (is that a defect?)

HDG.OHF.content: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material

HDG.OHF.content: phenomenology can only be appropriated (zugeeignet) phenomenologically, i.e. through demonstration (Ausweisung), & not by repeating Grundsätze or following Schuldogmen > we’re constantly deceived about things in themselves: once the conscience of philosophy, “now a pimp (Zuhälterin) for the public whoring of the mind (öffentlichen Hurerei des Geistes), fornicatio spiritus” (Luther)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: phenomenology can only be appropriated (zugeeignet) phenomenologically, i.e. through demonstration (Ausweisung), & not by repeating Grundsätze or following Schuldogmen > we’re constantly deceived about things in themselves: once the conscience of philosophy, “now a pimp (Zuhälterin) for the public whoring of the mind (öffentlichen Hurerei des Geistes), fornicatio spiritus” (Luther)

HDG.OHF.content: [method warning re: phenomenology] not about obtaining/delivering propositions/dogmas re: Dasein, generating a philosophy around it > rather, a special investigation w/ view to right direction of looking toward genuine phenomenon
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method warning re: phenomenology] not about obtaining/delivering propositions/dogmas re: Dasein, generating a philosophy around it > rather, a special investigation w/ view to right direction of looking toward genuine phenomenon

HDG.OHF.content: two modes of Dasein of today (Dasein im Heute) (discourse about Dasein) [initial givens of today, closest to us? (Zunächst des Heute)] (: 1) historical consciousness 2) philosophy > modes of interpreting, modes of Dasein’s having-itself in a definite manner, must interrogate these modes to interrogate Dasein of today, to subject the today to a destruction > genuine question of hermeneutics: what Seinscharakter of Dasein shows up (zeigt sich) [cf. Sage as showing] in these modes of having-itself (Sichselbstshabens)?
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: two modes of Dasein of today (Dasein im Heute) (discourse about Dasein) [initial givens of today, closest to us? (Zunächst des Heute)] (: 1) historical consciousness 2) philosophy > modes of interpreting, modes of Dasein’s having-itself in a definite manner, must interrogate these modes to interrogate Dasein of today, to subject the today to a destruction > genuine question of hermeneutics: what Seinscharakter of Dasein shows up (zeigt sich) [cf. Sage as showing] in these modes of having-itself (Sichselbstshabens)?

HDG.OHF.content: [method] [from] as what is factical Dasein being encountered in historical consciousness & philosophy? [to] what does factical Dasein have itself in these interpretations? [to] what is the having-itself-there of Da-sein as being, as a How of facticity, as an existential?
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method] [from] as what is factical Dasein being encountered in historical consciousness & philosophy? [to] what does factical Dasein have itself in these interpretations? [to] what is the having-itself-there of Da-sein as being, as a How of facticity, as an existential?

HDG.OHF.content: [method] to discover the as what encountered via todayness of historical consciousness & philosophy, we follow a path of analysis “in which we look to their particular modes of being-related (Weise des Bezogenseins) to their object”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method] to discover the as what encountered via todayness of historical consciousness & philosophy, we follow a path of analysis “in which we look to their particular modes of being-related (Weise des Bezogenseins) to their object”

HDG.OHF.content: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]

HDG.OHF.content: attention (aufmerksam) should’ve been called to certain difficulty: many directions of philosophy today don’t provide much basis for phenomenological analysis Heidegger is initiating here
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: attention (aufmerksam) should’ve been called to certain difficulty: many directions of philosophy today don’t provide much basis for phenomenological analysis Heidegger is initiating here

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis

HDG.OHF.content: philosophy as universal classification (Ordnen), encompasses (umspannt) totality of culture (Gesamtheit der Kultur), the system of cultural systems > this totality not examined as theme in philosophy > temporal itself not investigated, but rather is that from out of which (von dem aus) classifying takes its point of departure (das Ordnen seinen Ausgang nimmt), so to insert it into context of classification > the comporting at point of departure (Ausgangsverhalten) of classifying grasps temporal in advance as types, essential generalities, only in this way can it enter a context of classification, so it doesn’t define or tarry in transitional stage, the one relevant for its actualizing > no one is disturbed by this, they characterize the point of departure as an object (temporal, empirical, mutable, subjective, real, singular, individual), in contrast to trans-temporal, ideal, universal
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: philosophy as universal classification (Ordnen), encompasses (umspannt) totality of culture (Gesamtheit der Kultur), the system of cultural systems > this totality not examined as theme in philosophy > temporal itself not investigated, but rather is that from out of which (von dem aus) classifying takes its point of departure (das Ordnen seinen Ausgang nimmt), so to insert it into context of classification > the comporting at point of departure (Ausgangsverhalten) of classifying grasps temporal in advance as types, essential generalities, only in this way can it enter a context of classification, so it doesn’t define or tarry in transitional stage, the one relevant for its actualizing > no one is disturbed by this, they characterize the point of departure as an object (temporal, empirical, mutable, subjective, real, singular, individual), in contrast to trans-temporal, ideal, universal

HDG.OHF.content: developing (Ausbilden) of context of classificatory order is the leading self-conditioning mode of philosophy [the other 2: 1) the Ausgangsverhalten 2) accommodating multiplicity of types], analogous to holding-in-view of style in historical consciousness > this leading mode not a mere depicting, but a creative developing (schöpferisches Ausbilden) of the order itself: fashions (bildet) for/out of itself possibility of a universal process
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: developing (Ausbilden) of context of classificatory order is the leading self-conditioning mode of philosophy [the other 2: 1) the Ausgangsverhalten 2) accommodating multiplicity of types], analogous to holding-in-view of style in historical consciousness > this leading mode not a mere depicting, but a creative developing (schöpferisches Ausbilden) of the order itself: fashions (bildet) for/out of itself possibility of a universal process

HDG.OHF.content: being everywhere & nowhere of philosophical knowing: an absolute curiosity (Neugier) [Heidegger then describes something close to idle talk, how philosophy is public, has an autonomous curiosity, gives itself a foothold in life, thus preserving itself]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: being everywhere & nowhere of philosophical knowing: an absolute curiosity (Neugier) [Heidegger then describes something close to idle talk, how philosophy is public, has an autonomous curiosity, gives itself a foothold in life, thus preserving itself]

HDG.OHF.content: objective scientific type of philosophy: proper refuge (Schutzwehr) in which Dasein protected from abysmal (bodenlosen) relativism, finds a secure foothold, brings objective possibility of more objective agreement (Übereinstimmung), “All of us…”, i.e. presents Dasein w/ tranquil certainty/security (ruhige Sicherheit) of general/unanimous “yes, I agree” [a force against snarl of worldviews, & rampant skepticism of our day] > when the system is dynamic has character of life itself, simultaneously universal & concrete [not subjective]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: objective scientific type of philosophy: proper refuge (Schutzwehr) in which Dasein protected from abysmal (bodenlosen) relativism, finds a secure foothold, brings objective possibility of more objective agreement (Übereinstimmung), “All of us…”, i.e. presents Dasein w/ tranquil certainty/security (ruhige Sicherheit) of general/unanimous “yes, I agree” [a force against snarl of worldviews, & rampant skepticism of our day] > when the system is dynamic has character of life itself, simultaneously universal & concrete [not subjective]

HDG.OHF.content: [Hegel as objective scientific philosophy] “Spirit” now lives in abode (Ort) of its self-certainty, no more goals, feelings, interests: “life has retired (zurückgezogen) into its authentic freedom”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Hegel as objective scientific philosophy] “Spirit” now lives in abode (Ort) of its self-certainty, no more goals, feelings, interests: “life has retired (zurückgezogen) into its authentic freedom”

HDG.OHF.content: [method: Heidegger now tries to show what is there for Dasein in the 2 interpretative modes (philosophy, historical consciousness)] Dasein itself goes toward something, having itself objectively there for itself, bringing itself objectively into its there > historical consciousness & philosophy are modes of Dasein, paths held open (preserved in itself), paths of securing/making certain, paths of falling away > Dasein encounters itself free of standpoints in objective certainty: 1) historical consciousness, Dasein encounters wealth of objective being of its having-been (Gewesenseins) 2) philosophy, Dasein encounters immutability of its always-being-in-such-a-manner (Immersoseins) > both interpretations bring Dasein before its highest & pure present
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method: Heidegger now tries to show what is there for Dasein in the 2 interpretative modes (philosophy, historical consciousness)] Dasein itself goes toward something, having itself objectively there for itself, bringing itself objectively into its there > historical consciousness & philosophy are modes of Dasein, paths held open (preserved in itself), paths of securing/making certain, paths of falling away > Dasein encounters itself free of standpoints in objective certainty: 1) historical consciousness, Dasein encounters wealth of objective being of its having-been (Gewesenseins) 2) philosophy, Dasein encounters immutability of its always-being-in-such-a-manner (Immersoseins) > both interpretations bring Dasein before its highest & pure present

HDG.OHF.content: [history of human sciences & philosophy orienting themselves in 19th century toward demarcation (Abgrenzung) of natural sciences, following Kant?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [history of human sciences & philosophy orienting themselves in 19th century toward demarcation (Abgrenzung) of natural sciences, following Kant?]

HDG.OHF.content: [method] to hit upon object in primordial manner: 1) provide/sketch in advance character of being of object of philosophy 2) provide/sketch character of way it becomes object for us 3) right way to gain access to it & bring it to true safekeeping
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method] to hit upon object in primordial manner: 1) provide/sketch in advance character of being of object of philosophy 2) provide/sketch character of way it becomes object for us 3) right way to gain access to it & bring it to true safekeeping

HDG.OHF.content: “phenomenon” will become truly earnest matter if it turns that to be in mode of covering-up-itself (Sich-verdeckens) & self-veiling (Sich-verschleierns) [which constitutes object of philosophy] belongs to Seinscharakter des Seins [withdrawal of Being]: phenomenology in radical sense
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “phenomenon” will become truly earnest matter if it turns that to be in mode of covering-up-itself (Sich-verdeckens) & self-veiling (Sich-verschleierns) [which constitutes object of philosophy] belongs to Seinscharakter des Seins [withdrawal of Being]: phenomenology in radical sense

HDG.OHF.content: [summary of historical consciousness & philosophy re: how Dasein sees itself]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [summary of historical consciousness & philosophy re: how Dasein sees itself]

HDG.OHF.content: forehaving: what is had in advance re: accessing/dealing w/ matter in question > fate of our approach (das Schicksal des Ansatzes) hangs on the primordiality (Ürsprunglichkeit) & genuineness (Echtheit) of the forehaving (in which Dasein as such [factical life] has been placed) [how can you ever assess forehaving unless you simply presume proximity?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: forehaving: what is had in advance re: accessing/dealing w/ matter in question > fate of our approach (das Schicksal des Ansatzes) hangs on the primordiality (Ürsprunglichkeit) & genuineness (Echtheit) of the forehaving (in which Dasein as such [factical life] has been placed) [how can you ever assess forehaving unless you simply presume proximity?]

HDG.OHF.content: decisive for development (Ausbildung) of a forehaving: seeing Dasein in its everydayness (Alltäglichkeit) > [cf. p. 62] formal indication of forehaving, in average everydayness: factical life means being-in-a-world > what is meant by “world” by “in” by “being”? investigation of each word not piecemeal but one point of view on same unitary phenomenon [demonstrated in intuition?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: decisive for development (Ausbildung) of a forehaving: seeing Dasein in its everydayness (Alltäglichkeit) > [cf. p. 62] formal indication of forehaving, in average everydayness: factical life means being-in-a-world > what is meant by “world” by “in” by “being”? investigation of each word not piecemeal but one point of view on same unitary phenomenon [demonstrated in intuition?]

HDG.OHF.content: world as something we are concerned about/attend to (Besorgte), shows itself as the wherefrom, out of which, and on the basis of which factical life is lived (woraus das faktische Leben lebt)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: world as something we are concerned about/attend to (Besorgte), shows itself as the wherefrom, out of which, and on the basis of which factical life is lived (woraus das faktische Leben lebt)

HDG.OHF.content: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]

HDG.OHF.content: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”

HDG.OHF.content: authentic mode of being in world is caring, meaning: producing, putting in place, directing ourselves to tasks, taking into possession, preventing, protecting against loss, etc. > in caring, life approaches/addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly man > caring always concerned about itself [auto-affection?]: not a reflexivity of caring back upon itself, no, caring meets up w/ itself in a worldy manner in the there it is encountering [from implicit to explicit] > to be in the how of such caring: Besorgnis (anxious concern and its apprehensions)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: authentic mode of being in world is caring, meaning: producing, putting in place, directing ourselves to tasks, taking into possession, preventing, protecting against loss, etc. > in caring, life approaches/addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly man > caring always concerned about itself [auto-affection?]: not a reflexivity of caring back upon itself, no, caring meets up w/ itself in a worldy manner in the there it is encountering [from implicit to explicit] > to be in the how of such caring: Besorgnis (anxious concern and its apprehensions)

HDG.OHF.content: life cares for itself, and since care in each case has a language, life addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly manner
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: life cares for itself, and since care in each case has a language, life addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly manner

HDG.OHF.content: der Einsatz (initial engagement & bringing into play), “as what” facticity is grasped/stirred in advance, arises out of fundamental experience, out of truth of primordial self-interpretation of philosophy
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: der Einsatz (initial engagement & bringing into play), “as what” facticity is grasped/stirred in advance, arises out of fundamental experience, out of truth of primordial self-interpretation of philosophy
